#Text=Bush has a rehearsed tele-conference with US troops in Iraq
#Text=Friday , October 14 , 2005
#Text=The live presidential video teleconference held Thursday by George Bush with U.S. troops stationed in Iraq drew fire from critics and even some Pentagon military leaders .
#Text=Pentagon officials defended the teleconference , saying that the soldiers stated their own opinions .

#Text=An on-camera shot before the teleconference went live showed Allison Barber , the deputy assistant defense secretary , coaching 10 soldiers on broad topics to which the president would want questions directed ; then rehearsed their actions on camera and reminded them of what questions were assigned to each soldier .
#Text=" OK , so let 's just walk through this , " Barber said .
#Text=" Captain Kennedy , you answer the first question and you hand the mike to whom ?
#Text=" Captain .

column1: #Text=During the live conference , when asked about Iraq 's preparations for their constitutional referendum , 1st Lt. Gregg Murphy of Tennessee said :
#Text=" Sir , we are prepared to do whatever it takes to make this thing a success . ...

#Text=Corine Lombardo from Scotia , N.Y. , a Public Relations officer at the 42nd Infantry Division HQ , said to Bush :  I can tell you over the past 10 months , we 've seen a tremendous increase in the capabilities and the confidences of our Iraqi security force partners . ...

#Text= I think all they were doing was talking to the troops and letting them know what to expect , " he said .

column1: #Text=He also said that the troops were expressing their own thoughts .
#Text=With satellite feeds , coordination often is needed to overcome technological challenges , such as delays , he said .
#Text=Later , Pentagon officials denied that the conference was staged .
#Text=Pentagon spokesman Lawrence Di Rita said " On behalf of these fine young men and women , we certainly regret any perception that they were told what to say .

#Text=It is not the case ,  adding that " The soldiers were advised as to the issues they should expect to discuss , and decided among themselves who would speak to each issue as it may arise .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=The director of Operation Truth , a New York -based advocacy group for U.S. veterans of Iraq and Afghanistan , described the event as a  carefully scripted publicity stunt " .

column1: #Text=" If he wants the real opinions of the troops , he ca n't do it in a nationally televised teleconference , " Paul Rieckhoff said .
#Text=" He needs to be talking to the boots on the ground and that 's not a bunch of captains .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=Sgt Ron Long , one of the troops interviewed , denied that it was scripted on his blog , writing  First of all , we were told that we would be speaking with the President of the United States , our Commander-in-Chief , President Bush , so I believe that it would have been totally irresponsible for us NOT to prepare some ideas , facts or comments that we wanted to share with the President .
